pma:database.pma:table: CREATE TABLE `baza_wraki` ( `id` int NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT, `nazwa` varchar(255) NOT NULL DEFAULT '', `pozycja_n` float(5,4) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0.0000', `pozycja_e` float(5,4) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0.0000', `info` varchar(255) NOT NULL DEFAULT '', `opis` text NOT NULL, `opis_en` text NOT NULL, `dlugosc` varchar(11) NOT NULL DEFAULT '', `szerokosc` varchar(11) NOT NULL DEFAULT '', `zanurzenie` varchar(11) NOT NULL DEFAULT '', `wypornosc` varchar(11) NOT NULL DEFAULT '', `naped` varchar(255) NOT NULL DEFAULT '', `uzbrojenie` text NOT NULL, `glebokosc_wraku` varchar(255) NOT NULL DEFAULT '', `glebokosc_nadnia` varchar(255) NOT NULL DEFAULT '', `pictures` text NOT NULL, `lang` char(2) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'pl', `status` int NOT NULL DEFAULT '0', `szer_geo_deg` varchar(6) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0', `szer_geo_min` varchar(6) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0', `szer_geo_sec` varchar(6) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0', `dlug_geo_deg` varchar(6) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0', `dlug_geo_min` varchar(6) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0', `dlug_geo_sec` varchar(6) NOT NULL DEFAULT '0', PRIMARY KEY (`id`) ) ENGINE=MyISAM AUTO_INCREMENT=95 DEFAULT CHARSET=latin1 COMMENT='Baza wraków wersja pierwsza';

S/T BURGERMEISTER PETERSEN
vel. Tankowiec
Tanker with mechanical drive. Driven with steam machine. Ship driven by one four blade screw with regular stroke. Crew 34 persons. Two deck construction. Built in August 1889 for shipowner Siemers, in shipyard Sir W. G. Armstrong, Mitchell & What, Low Walker number plans 553, under name S / T BURGERMEISTER PETERSEN. Delivered to use 17.09.1889. From 27.05.1891 she served for D. A. P. G. (Deutsch Amerikansiche Petroleum Ges, Hamburg).From 19.09.1914 she served as auxiliary ship for Uboots ( he was used as an oiler).
From 27.10.1915 she transferred to Kaiserliche Werft Danzig as oiler to transport fuel for ships.
On 10.11.1915 she was destroyed by mine and sunk. 20 crew members died.
Shipowner Siemers, DAPG, service in navy..

History of duty
FRANKEN
Tanker oiler with mechanical drive. Driven with four 9 cylinders Diesel engines. Equipped wiyh two screws with regular stroke.
She was built in shipyard Deutche Wrek Kiel in 1937 year. However ship was not delivered to use before the begining of II WW. The hulk was launched 08.03.1939. After begining of war the works were provided slowly, only when the shipyard did not have more urgent works. In 1942 year Franken was towed away to Burmeister & Wain shipyard in Copenhagen, where she was finished and started his service on 17.03.1943. The tanker oiler operated only in Baltic Sea region as provider for battleship the Prinz the Eugen. She provided torpedo ships and minesweeping ships. She was sunk by Soviet bombers near Hel 08.04.1945 year.
.

History of duty
Monika Munksholm
Monika Trigon
West Star
By dint of Marcin Jaworek inquiry we can give details of West Star's service. In 1965 year ship was built  for German shipowner in shipyard  Atlas-Werke in Brema, Germany. Finally, it sold to Danish shipowner Partrederi „Trigon” , Kopenhagen. Ship orginally named „Monika Munksholm”, and next „Monika Trigon”.  After next change shipowner to Rederi K/S Westcoast  company, Danish, ship was named "West Star". Helsinborg was its port of registry. It is known what happend few hours before sinking. Danish ship West Star under command of capt. Erik Olsen went for her last voyage on sunday October 25th 1970. They were sailing from Gdansk to United Kingdom with load of wood. At 02:55 local time (CET) they sand a distress call "MAYDAY MAYDAY" due to high angle heel. At 8 in the morning on Friday October 30th
after long fight with heel capt. Olsen abandon the ship.

Freight ship with mechanical drive. Equipped in steam machine. Driven by one screw with regular stroke (second spare on deck) . She was built in shipyard the Unterweser in Lehe, number of building 1917. This Swedish steamer was torpeded through Soviet submarime SC-406. Seven of persons of crew steamer was undertaken by Russians. These men "disappears" in USSR. ex. s/y SCHWARZEIR HUSAR
She was the first full sized seagoing yacht owned and operated by Polish Scouting Association. She has been bought in Danmark in 1934. She was in service until begning of Second World War in 1939.
She has been built in 1901 by I.E. Holma, A.K. Gustafsson, Raa w Szwecji. Her strong structure allowed subpolar expeditions. She has been bought basing on citizens collection. Her refitting has been completed by scouts and students who later sail the yacht.
During Second World War she has been used by Germans as s/y SCHWARZE HUSAR. However later theyrenounce her. After the war she was found in very bad condition. After towing  to Gdynia it was decided to ground  she in the bottom of Bay of Puck.

Ordered 27.03.1961.Launched 25.09.1962, sea tests were finished 14.12.1961. Ship transported small fragments and not loose goods. Thanks to two deck constructions she could take palette, goods packed in bags, but first of all tractors and agricultural machines.
The ship sinked at Polish coasts 27.07.1975. Six persons died. Rest of the crew was saved by training ships s / s ZENIT and s / s HORYZONT from the Higher Sea School in Gdynia.
In March 2006 Polish divers checked it during diving from training ship s/s Horyzont II of Sea Akademy in Gdynia. The captain and first officer of HORYZONT II in 1975 were crew members on "Zenith" and on the first "Horizon".
